pageTitle: Green Country Grand Prix Majors Tour info on Apr 5, 2014 (064985) | MotorsportReg.com
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {38838=Registration closed April 3, 2014 12:00 PM on April 3, 2014 12:00 PM CDT Registration ends April 3, 2014 12:00 PM on April 3, 2014 12:00 PM CDT Registration opens February 28, 2014 9:00 AM on February 28, 2014 9:00 AM CST Registration runs from February 28, 2014 9:00 AM to April 3, 2014 12:00 PM, 16315=1. This event, organized by NEOKLA/OKLAHOMA/WICHITA Regions, SCCA, will be held under the 2014 General Competition Rules.}
textBeforeTable: 12. All Majors participants must qualify within 115% of the recognized lap record in his/her class in order to be allowed to start the race.  The Series Chief Steward may waive this requirement and may allow nonqualifiers to grid behind qualifiers.  See Chart below:   11. All cars are required to have US Majors Tour stickers visibly placed on each side of the vehicle.  Stickers will be provided free of charge and may be obtained at registration and/or tech.   10. At least the top three cars per class will be impounded to check for compliance, but we ask all drivers to participate in the Victory Circle celebrations.  Tour provided door prizes will be awarded after each feature race at podium ceremonies person selected must be present to win.   9. For Sunday races only, following the cool down lap, the winner of each class should proceed immediately down pit road where they will receive a checkered flag and be directed on course for a single Victory Lap.  Drivers need not wear their helmet or gloves during the victory lap and passengers are permitted in accordance with GCR 6.11.7.  Drivers shall maintain a safe speed and be wary of safety vehicles which may be on course.   8. The sprint race will be gridded based on fastest lap in the qualifying session.  The feature race will be gridded based
textAfterTable: • * - Track record not available, drivers must be within 115% of the class pole-sitter to participate.   13. Majors staff and their delegates may install data acquisition equipment in a competitor’s car. This program is to assist the CRB in performance balancing.  If selected, participation is not optional and is not protestable.  The data collected will not be used for compliance purposes.   14. When possible, the MajorsTour “1 to Go” sign will be displayed at start/finish to indicate the last lap has begun.   15. PLEASE NOTE: Schedule session times are approximate and are for planning purposes only.  Actual start times may vary based on forces of nature and on-track incidents.  Stewards will not take actions on minor schedule changes.   Registration and Entries   16. Online entry available at www.motorsportreg.com.  Please be sure to provide cell phone numbers when registering for contact at the track if necessary.  Registrar: Betty Martin, 5421 E. 21 Place, Tulsa, OK 74114, 918-744-6392, between 9 A.M. and 9:00 P.M.  E-mail: Btymartin@AOL.com.   17. Entry Fees:  Majors Tour - $485;   Spec Racer Ford and Formula E add $20.00 for SCCA Compliance fee. Second entry/same driver - $300 for both days.     18. For entries received by the registrar through noon on March 15, Majors Series numbers
